intro: Limonium cavanillesii, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which are adapted to coastal environments. The plant belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in sandy soils. Limonium cavanillesii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature. Its flowers bloom in late summer, adding a striking visual element to coastal landscapes.
